courses.title: Introduction to Programming
courses.description: Fundamentals of programming concepts, problem-solving techniques, and introduction to C programming language.
outcomes: Students can write well-structured C programs
Students can solve complex problems using programming
Students understand memory management and pointers
Students can debug and optimize their code

courses.title: Discrete Mathematics
courses.description: Mathematical foundations for computer science including logic, sets, relations, functions, and graph theory.
outcomes: Students understand set theory and relations
Students can apply graph theory concepts

courses.title: Data Structures
courses.description: Implementation and application of fundamental data structures including arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs.
outcomes: Students can implement all major data structures
Students can solve problems using appropriate structures

courses.title: Algorithms
courses.description: Comprehensive study of algorithm analysis and design. Topics include sorting, searching, graph algorithms, dynamic programming, and complexity analysis (Big O). Emphasis on solving complex computational problems efficiently.
outcomes: Analyze the asymptotic performance of algorithms.
Demonstrate a familiarity with major algorithms and data structures.
Apply important algorithmic design paradigms and methods of analysis.
Synthesize efficient algorithms in common engineering design situations.

items.label: VisuAlgo
items.description: Visualize data structures and algorithms through animation.

items.label: Algorithm Visualizer
items.description: View code execution and visualization side-by-side (JS/Java/C++).

items.label: Python Tutor
items.description: Step through code execution to understand memory and recursion frames.

items.label: CSES Problem Set
items.description: Standard collection of classic competitive programming problems.

items.label: LeetCode: Algorithms
items.description: Structured study plan for interview preparation.

items.label: CP-Algorithms
items.description: Comprehensive wiki with detailed explanations of advanced algorithms.

items.label: Grokking Algorithms
items.description: Aditya Bhargava. A fully illustrated, friendly guide providing intuition.

items.label: The Algorithm Design Manual
items.description: Steven Skiena. Focuses on real-world design and 'war stories'.

items.label: Introduction to Algorithms (CLRS)
items.description: Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, Stein. The definitive, comprehensive textbook.

items.label: Autumn 2020 Lectures (Archive)
items.description: Complete video archive of the Autumn 2020 semester sessions.

items.label: Summer 2021 Python Lectures (Archive)
items.description: Video archive of the Python-based sessions from Summer 2021.

items.label: MIT 6.006: Intro to Algorithms
items.description: World-class university lectures covering foundational topics.

items.label: Abdul Bari's Algorithms
items.description: Highly rated community tutorials simplifying complex concepts.

courses.title: Numerical Methods
courses.description: Numerical techniques for solving mathematical problems including root finding, interpolation, numerical integration, and differential equations.
outcomes: Students can solve engineering problems numerically
Students can use MATLAB for scientific computing

courses.title: Finite Automata and Computability
courses.description: Theory of computation including finite automata, regular expressions, context-free grammars, and Turing machines.
outcomes: Students can design automata and grammars

courses.title: Fundamentals of Computer System
courses.description: Introduction to computer organization, binary systems, logic design, and basic computer architecture.
outcomes: Students understand binary and hexadecimal systems
Students can design basic logic circuits
Students can work with assembly language basics

courses.title: Computer Graphics Lab
courses.description: Practical application of computer graphics principles including 2D/3D transformations, rendering, and OpenGL programming.

courses.title: Numerical Methods Lab
courses.description: Laboratory sessions for implementing numerical methods algorithms and solving engineering problems.

courses.title: Compiler Design Lab
courses.description: Practical implementation of compiler components including lexical analysis, parsing, and code generation.

courses.title: Android Development Lab
courses.description: Hands-on development of Android mobile applications using Java and Android SDK.
outcomes: Students can publish apps to Play Store
